Field.Name: Sender's Reference
Field.Definition: This field specifies the reference assigned by the Sender to unambiguously identify the message.
Field.Usage: The reference must be unique for each message (or chain of messages) and is part of the message identification and transaction identification which is to be used in related queries, cancellations, etc.

Field.Name: Customer Specified Reference
Field.Definition: This field specifies the reference to the entire message assigned by either the instructing party, when present or ordering customer, when the instructing party is not present.
Field.Usage: When this field is present, the ordering customer requests a single debit entry for the sum of the amounts of all transactions in the instruction, even if this instruction is chained in several messages. If the field is not used, all debit items are posted individually.

Field.Name: Message Index/Total
Field.Definition: This field chains different messages by specifying the sequence number in the total number of messages.
Field.Usage: Both the message index and the total number of messages allow the receiver to check that all transactions to be executed have been received.

Field.Name: Instructing Party
Field.Definition: This field identifies the customer which is authorised by the account owner/account servicing institution to order all the transactions in the message.
Field.Usage: This field must only be used when the instructing customer is not also the account owner.

Field.Name: Ordering Customer
Field.Definition: This field identifies the account owner whose account is to be debited with all transactions in sequence B.
Field.Usage: Both the account number of the ordering customer at the Receiver or at the account servicing institution and the name and address or the non-financial institution BIC of the ordering customer must be present. Both the account number of the ordering customer at the Receiver or at the account servicing institution and the name and address or the non-financial institution BIC of the ordering customer must be present.

Field.Name: Account Servicing Institution
Field.Definition: This field specifies the account servicing institution - when other than the Receiver - which services the account of the account owner to be debited. This is applicable even if field 50a Ordering Customer contains an IBAN.
Field.Usage: The coded information contained in field 52a should be meaningful to the Receiver of the message.

Option.Name: Canadian Payments Association Payment Routing Number
China National Advanced Payment Routing Number
Canadian Payments Association Payment Routing Number
China National Advanced Payment Routing Number

Field.Name: Sending Institution (BIC)
Field.Definition: This field identifies the Sender of the message.
Field.Usage: At least the first eight characters of the Identifier Code in this field must be identical to the originator of this FileAct message. The content of field 20 Sender's Reference together with the content of this field provides the message identification which is to be used in the case of queries, cancellations, etc.

Field.Name: Requested Execution Date
Field.Definition: This field specifies the date on which all subsequent transactions should be initiated by the executing bank.
Field.Usage: This is the date on which the ordering customer's account(s) is (are) to be debited.

Field.Name: Authorisation
Field.Definition: This field specifies additional security provisions, for example, a digital signature, between the ordering customer/instructing party and the account servicing financial institution.
Field.Usage: The purpose of this field is to allow the account servicing institution to confirm that the account owner did indeed authorise this instruction. The account owner and the account servicing institution will agree on the mechanism for providing this security information, for example, the account servicing institution may provide the account owner with an electronic device that generates a new security code each time the account owner requests a new payment.

Field.Name: Transaction Reference
Field.Definition: This field contains the unique reference for the individual transaction contained in a particular occurrence of sequence B.
Field.Usage: In transaction specific queries, cancellations, etc., the Sender's reference together with the content of this field provides the transaction identification.

Field.Name: F/X Deal Reference
Field.Definition: This field specifies the foreign exchange contract reference between the ordering customer and the account servicing financial institution.
Field.Usage: The following code may be used: NONREF (There is no underlying foreign exchange deal to this transaction)

Field.Name: Instruction Code
Field.Definition: This field specifies instructions to be used between the ordering customer and the account servicer.

Field.Name: Currency/Transaction Amount
Field.Definition: This field specifies the currency and the amount of the subsequent transfer to be executed by the Receiver.
Field.Usage: The amount is subject to deduction of the Receiver's/beneficiary bank's charges if field 71A is BEN or SHA.

Field.Name: Instructing Party
Field.Definition: This field identifies the customer which is authorised by the account owner/account servicing institution to order all the transactions in the message.
Field.Usage: This field must only be used when the instructing customer is not also the account owner.

Field.Name: Ordering Customer
Field.Definition: This field identifies the account owner whose account is to be debited with all transactions in sequence B.
Field.Usage: Both the account number of the ordering customer at the Receiver or at the account servicing institution and the name and address or the non-financial institution BIC of the ordering customer must be present. Both the account number of the ordering customer at the Receiver or at the account servicing institution and the name and address or the non-financial institution BIC of the ordering customer must be present.

Field.Name: Account Servicing Institution
Field.Definition: This field specifies the account servicing institution - when other than the Receiver - which services the account of the account owner to be debited. This is applicable even if field 50a Ordering Customer contains an IBAN.
Field.Usage: The coded information contained in field 52a should be meaningful to the Receiver of the message.

Option.Name: Canadian Payments Association Payment Routing Number
China National Advanced Payment Routing Number
Canadian Payments Association Payment Routing Number
China National Advanced Payment Routing Number

Field.Name: Intermediary
Field.Definition: This field specifies the financial institution through which the transaction must pass to reach the account with institution.
Field.Usage: The intermediary may be a branch or affiliate of the Receiver or the account with institution, or an entirely different financial institution. When one of the codes //FW (with or without the 9-digit number), //AU, //CP or //IN is used, it should appear only once and in the first of the fields 56a and 57a of the payment instruction. When it is necessary that an incoming SWIFT payment be made to the party in this field via Fedwire, US banks require that the code //FW appears in the optional Party Identifier of field 56a or 57a. Option A is the preferred option. If the intermediary cannot be identified by a financial institution BIC, option C should be used containing a 2!a clearing system code preceded by a double slash '//'. Option D must only be used in exceptional circumstances: when the party cannot be identified by a financial institution BIC, when there is a need to be able to specify a name and address, for example, due to regulatory considerations or when there is a bilateral agreement between the Sender and the Receiver permitting its use. When qualified by a clearing system code or an account number, the use of option D will enable the automated processing of the instruction(s) by the Receiver.

Option.Name: Canadian Payments Association Payment Routing Number
China National Advanced Payment Routing Number
Canadian Payments Association Payment Routing Number
China National Advanced Payment Routing Number
Canadian Payments Association Payment Routing Number
China National Advanced Payment Routing Number

Field.Name: Account with Institution
Field.Definition: This field specifies the financial institution which services the account for the beneficiary customer. This is applicable even if field 59a contains an IBAN.
Field.Usage: When field 57a is not present, it means that the Receiver is also the account with institution. When one of the codes //FW (with or without the 9-digit number), //AU, //CP or //IN is used, it should appear only once and in the first of the fields 56a and 57a of the payment instruction. When it is necessary that an incoming SWIFT payment be made to the party in this field via Fedwire, US banks require that the code //FW appears in the optional Party Identifier of field 56a or 57a. Option A is the preferred option. If the intermediary cannot be identified by a financial institution BIC, option C should be used containing a 2!a clearing system code preceded by a double slash '//'. Option D must only be used in exceptional circumstances: when the party cannot be identified by a financial institution BIC, when there is a need to be able to specify a name and address, for example, due to regulatory considerations or when there is a bilateral agreement between the Sender and the Receiver permitting its use. When qualified by a clearing system code or an account number, the use of option D will enable the automated processing of the instruction(s) by the Receiver.

Option.Name: Canadian Payments Association Payment Routing Number
China National Advanced Payment Routing Number
Canadian Payments Association Payment Routing Number
China National Advanced Payment Routing Number
Canadian Payments Association Payment Routing Number
China National Advanced Payment Routing Number

Field.Name: Beneficiary
Field.Definition: This field identifies the beneficiary of the subsequent operation from the particular occurrence of sequence B.
Field.Usage: At least the name or BIC of the beneficiary customer is mandatory. If the account number of the beneficiary customer is known, it must be stated in Account. In option F: line codes may be repeated, if number 2 is present, the first occurrence of number 3 must include the town in the additional details, the first line must start with number 1, numbers must appear in numerical order, number 2 must not be used without number 3 and the first occurrence of number 3 must be followed by a valid ISO country code. In Option F the first occurrence of number 3 must be followed by a slash, '/', the ISO country code and, optionally, additional details that are preceded by a slash '/'. Other occurrence(s) of number 3 must be followed by a slash '/' and the continuation of additional details.

Field.Name: Remittance Information
Field.Definition: This field specifies details of the individual transactions which are to be transmitted to the beneficiary customer.
Field.Usage: The information specified in this field is intended only for the beneficiary customer, that is, this information only needs to be conveyed by the Receiver.

Field.Name: Regulatory Reporting
Field.Definition: This field specifies the codes for the statutory and/or regulatory information required by the authorities in the country of the receiver or the sender/originating customer.
Field.Usage: The information specified must not have been explicitly conveyed in another field.

Field.Name: Currency / Original Ordered Amount
Field.Definition: This field specifies the original currency and amount as specified by the ordering customer.
Field.Usage: This field is used when the currency and amount are different from those specified in field 32B.

Field.Name: Details of Charges
Field.Definition: This field specifies which party will bear the applicable charges for the subsequent transfer of funds.

Field.Name: Charges Account
Field.Definition: This field specifies the ordering customer's account number to which applicable transaction charges should be separately applied.
Field.Usage: When used, the account number must be different from the account number specified in field 50a Ordering Customer.

Field.Name: Exchange Rate
Field.Definition: This field specifies the exchange rate applied by the ordering customer/instructing party when converting the original ordered amount to the transaction amount.
Field.Usage: The integer part of Rate must contain at least one digit. A decimal comma is mandatory.
